SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
The main game class that manages the core game logic, player and NPC interactions, turn management, and scoring system.

This class follows the Singleton pattern to ensure only one instance exists during runtime. It maintains game state including current turn, player/NPC points, and game bet.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Game class.
      Returns:
      The single instance of Game

    • startGame

      private void startGame() throws SomeGameFieldsMissing
      Initializes and starts the game after validating required fields.
      Throws:
      SomeGameFieldsMissing - if any required game fields (player, NPC, or bet) are missing

    • setUpGame

      public void setUpGame(NPC npc, int gameBet) throws SomeGameFieldsMissing
      Configures the game with the selected NPC and initial bet.
      Parameters:
      npc - The NPC opponent to play against
      gameBet - The bet to be placed in the game
      Throws:
      SomeGameFieldsMissing - if setup validation fails

    • throwDice

      public void throwDice()
      Rolls the dice for the current turn. If the current turn is the player, it rolls the player's dice. Else, it rolls the NPC's dice.

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Ends the current turn and switches to the other player's turn. Also updates the score by adding points for the current turn.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Gets the current player instance.
      Returns:
      The Player object representing the human player

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the player instance for the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player object to set

    • getNpc

      public NPC getNpc()
      Gets the current NPC opponent instance.
      Returns:
      The NPC object representing the computer opponent

    • setNpc

      public void setNpc(NPC npc)
      Sets the NPC opponent for the game.
      Parameters:
      npc - The NPC object to set

    • getCurrentTurn

      public int getCurrentTurn()
      Gets the current turn indicator.
      Returns:
      0 for player's turn, 1 for NPC's turn

    • setCurrentTurn

      public void setCurrentTurn(int currentTurn)
      Sets the current turn indicator.
      Parameters:
      currentTurn - The value to set the current turn (0 for Player, 1 for NPC)

    • getGameBet

      public int getGameBet()
      Gets the current game bet.
      Returns:
      The bet placed for the game

    • getTurnScore

      public int getTurnScore()
      Gets the current score for the turn.
      Returns:
      The score accumulated in the current turn

    • setTurnScore

      public void setTurnScore(int turnScore)
      Sets the score for the current turn.
      Parameters:
      turnScore - The score to set for the current turn

    • getGameObserver

      public GameObserver getGameObserver()
      Gets the GameObserver instance.
      Returns:
      The GameObserver instance that monitors game events

    • setGameObserver

      public void setGameObserver(GameObserver gameObserver) throws SomeGameFieldsMissing
      Sets the GameObserver instance and starts the game.
      Parameters:
      gameObserver - The observer to attach to the game
      Throws:
      SomeGameFieldsMissing - if required fields are missing during the game setup

    • getRolledDice

      public List<Dice> getRolledDice()
      Gets the list of rolled dice for the current turn.
      Returns:
      A list of Dice objects representing the rolled dice

    • setRolledDice

      public void setRolledDice(List<Dice> rolledDice)
      Sets the list of rolled dice for the current turn.
      Parameters:
      rolledDice - A list of Dice objects to set as the rolled dice

    • getNpcScore

      Gets the current score of the NPC.

      Gets the score required to win the game.
      Returns:
      The score required to win the game

    • setScoreToWin

      public void setScoreToWin(int scoreToWin)
      Sets the score required to win the game.
      Parameters:
      scoreToWin - The score to set as the winning score

    • setNpcScore

      public void setNpcScore(int npcScore)
      Sets the current score of the NPC.
      Parameters:
      npcScore - The score to set for the NPC

      public void checkIfAnyOneWin()
      Checks if either the player or the NPC has won the game.
